channel.title: Homes on Christopher Prener
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Christopher Prener

item.title: New Paper and Updated Software
item.description: My R package areal, which implements a reproducible workflow for areal weighted interpolation, has been updated on CRAN. This is a joint effort with recent SLU graduate Charlie Revord. A paper summarizing our work has also been recently published in The Journal of Open Source Software.

Biography Chris is an urban and medical sociologist with an interest in mixed methods research designs that incorporate spatial data. He is currently revising his dissertation into a book manuscript entitled Medicine at the Margins. The book examines the effect of neighborhood context and conditions on emergency medical services work, particularly with patients who have mental illnesses or substance use disorders. With his research team, Chris is also working on a large ecometric project aimed at understanding disorder and crime in St.

item.title: Software
item.description: In addition to the R packages being developed as part of the SLU openGIS project, which are all focused on St. Louis data or on working with spatial data more generally, Chris also maintains a number of stand-alone R packages: driftR tidy tools that correct continuous water-quality monitoring data for incremental drift Project Website GitHub CRAN prener An “internal” R package (not destined for CRAN) that houses functions used in my research and teaching Website GitHub

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Current Fall 2018 Courses SOC 1120 - Introduction to Sociology: Diversity & Health SOC 4015 & 5050 - Quantitative Analysis: Applied Inferential Statistics SOC 4800 - Supervised Research Activity Past and Future Courses SOC 2180 - Cities and Space: St. Louis (under development) SOC 3220 - Urban Sociology & The Wire (on hiatus) SOC 4650 & 5650 - Introduction to Geographic Information Science (planned for Spring 2019) Other Teaching Activities Curriculum development for Data Carpentry’s social science and geospatial lessons Founding co-organizer of the Saint Louis University Data Science Seminar MCAT review course for Sociology and Psychology each spring Seminar on presenting information and data each semester
